"There's a reason why you never succeeded as an actor. You should stick to acting," the user had written. Harsh replied, "You're a nobody on Twitter that no one will...care about."

176.title: Third round of India-EU trade pact talks to start from November-end: Report
176.article_body: A delegation from the European Union (EU) is reportedly set to visit India on November 28 for the third round of talks for the India-EU Trade and Investment Agreement, including the Geographical Indications. According to the commerce ministry, the trade agreement with the EU would help India to further expand and diversify its exports of goods and services.

177.title: Pakistani fan recreates 2019 World Cup's viral angry reaction, ICC shares video
177.article_body: A Pakistani fan recreated the 2019 World Cup's viral angry reaction during Pakistan's T20 World Cup 2022 final defeat against England. The ICC shared a video of reaction of both the fans and wrote, "Thought this looked familiar!"  Notably, Pakistani cricket fan Sarim Akhtar had gone viral for staring angrily at Asif Ali after dropped catch during 2019 World Cup.

178.title: At least 6 dead in Istanbul blast, Turkey President says 'There is a smell of terror'
178.article_body: At least six people were killed and several others injured in a blast on a pedestrian street in Istanbul on Sunday. "It might be wrong if we say for sure...this is terror [attack] but according to first signs...there's a smell of terror there," Turkey President Recep Tayyip Erdoğan said. "Relevant units of our state are working to find...perpetrators," he added.

179.title: Met my husband through Ajay Devgn: 'Drishyam 2' actress Ishita Dutta
179.article_body: Actress Ishita Dutta, who'll next be seen in 'Drishyam 2', spoke about her co-star Ajay Devgn and revealed that because of him, she and her actor-husband Vatsal Sheth met and got married. "I met my husband through Ajay sir. I'm very happy that he was our matchmaker," she said. Vatsal is known for starring in 'Taarzan: The Wonder Car'.

180.title: Loved my time in IPL, learnt a lot: Curran after winning T20 WC
180.article_body: After being named the 'Player of the Tournament' and 'Man of the Match' in the T20 World Cup final on Sunday, English seamer Sam Curran said that he learnt a lot during his IPL stint. "I loved my time there (IPL)... It is fantastic learning from guys who have played in these tournaments and big occasions," Curran said.

181.title: Southeast Asia shouldn't become proxy to other powers: Indonesia
181.article_body: Indonesian President Joko Widodo on Sunday said that Southeast Asian countries should avoid becoming proxies to "any powers" and allowing "the current geopolitical dynamic" to turn into a "Cold War" in the region. Widodo's remarks came as Indonesia assumed ASEAN's chairmanship. Notably, there has been a recent rise in tensions between the US and China over Taiwan in the Asia-Pacific.

182.title: Ajay Devgn's 'Drishyam 2' gets U/A certificate, runtime to be 2 hrs 22 mins
182.article_body: Central Board of Film Certification (CBFC) has cleared Ajay Devgn and Tabu-starrer 'Drishyam 2' with U/A certificate. The film is expected to have a duration of 2 hours and 22 minutes. According to reports, the film has been passed with zero cuts. Directed by Abhishek Pathak, 'Drishyam 2' is set to release in theatres on November 18.

183.title: The improvement that Sam Curran has done is brilliant: Ian Bishop
183.article_body: Ex-West Indian pacer Ian Bishop said that the improvement that English seamer Sam Curran has made for the T20 World Cup in Australia is "brilliant". "It's not easy to be bowling across all the phases. If you think about...bowling in Australia, you think about really fast...[and] tall bowlers. Curran is among the shortest in this tournament," Bishop said.

184.title: Journalist beaten up with stick at Assam hospital; home guard suspended
184.article_body: A journalist was allegedly beaten up with a stick by a home guard when he had gone to deliver food for a relative admitted to a hospital in Assam's Cachar district on Saturday night. The home guard has been suspended, police said. Doctors have found five severe injuries on the journalist's body.

185.title: Robbers dismantle, steal ATM machine that had ₹10 lakh in Udaipur
185.article_body: A total of 5-6 people dismantled and took an ATM machine away in Rajasthan's Udaipur district, police said on Sunday. According to the bank to which the ATM belonged, the machine had ₹10 lakh in cash. The incident occurred on Saturday night when the accused held the ATM's guard hostage and took the ATM away in a vehicle, police said.

186.title: Tom Holland signs new deal for another 'Spider-Man' trilogy: Reports
186.article_body: Actor Tom Holland has reportedly signed a new deal for another 'Spider-Man' trilogy. It will be developed at Sony Pictures in partnership with Disney and Kevin Feige's Marvel Studios, as per reports. Tom has reportedly "closed a deal" for the yet-to-be-titled 'Spider-Man 4', the follow-up to 2021 film 'Spider-Man: No Way Home'.

187.title: Odisha man removes cobra's fangs with nail cutter, arrested after video surfaces
187.article_body: A man from Odisha has been arrested after a video purportedly showing him extracting the fangs of a king cobra with the help of a nail cutter surfaced online. According to the state Forest Department, the cobra has been rescued from Bileisarda. A case has been registered and further investigation into the incident is underway.

188.title: Rahul beats drum with artists at Maha cultural show, video surfaces
188.article_body: During the ongoing 'Bharat Jodo Yatra', Congress leader Rahul Gandhi was seen beating a drum with artists at a cultural show in Kalamnuri, Hingoli district in Maharashtra. In a video, which has surfaced online, Gandhi can be seen hugging and shaking hands with the artists. The foot march commenced on September 7 from Kanyakumari in Tamil Nadu.

189.title: RRR opening scene took 35 days to shoot, Akshay does 1 film in 40 days: Charan
189.article_body: Actor Ram Charan said that his opening scene in SS Rajamouli's 'RRR' took 35 days to shoot. "Akshay Kumar sir finished a movie in 40 days or so I heard," he added. "I have had a dust allergy since childhood...I had even undergone sinus surgery. Look at my fate, I had to work in dust for 35 days," Ram stated.

190.title: NIA reaches Udaipur railway track site where explosion caused cracks
190.article_body: Those involved in the explosion on a newly opened railway line between Udaipur and Ahmedabad will be severely punished, Railway Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw said on Sunday. He said the NIA along with other investigating agencies was at the site. The explosion occurred hours before the recently inaugurated Asarwa-Udaipur Express train from Ahmedabad was supposed to pass on the route.

191.title: Abhishek, Jaya, Shabana attend director Rakesh Kumar's prayer meet
191.article_body: A prayer meeting was held for late actor-filmmaker Rakesh Kumar on Sunday in Mumbai. Abhishek Bachchan, Jaya Bachchan and Shabana Azmi, among other Bollywood celebrities, paid their last respects to the director. Rakesh Kumar passed away on November 10 in Mumbai after a battle with cancer. He was best known for films like 'Mr Natwarlal', 'Khoon Pasina' and 'Yaarana'.

192.title: Only Pakistan could've stretched England this far: Chopra
192.article_body: After Pakistan lost to England in the T20 World Cup final after the former posted a total of 137 runs, ex-Indian batter Aakash Chopra said that Pakistan's bowling "made a match of it". "To be honest, only Pakistan could've stretched England this far. Outstanding bowling unit," Chopra said. England won the match by five wickets with an over to spare.

193.title: 2 children hit by UP Police vehicle on busy street, probe ordered
193.article_body: Two children were hit by a vehicle belonging to the Uttar Pradesh Police on a busy street in Uttar Pradesh's Baghpat district on Saturday. The children were immediately rushed to a nearby hospital, where they received first-aid treatment. According to a senior officer, a probe has been ordered into the incident and a report has been sought within 24 hours.

194.title: FTX logo dropped out of ICC T20 World Cup Final after bankruptcy
194.article_body: The logo of FTX was taken down from the post-match presentation background stands that sport the sponsors' logos, dugouts and boundary triangles in the ICC T20 World Cup final on Sunday. The cryptocurrency exchange declared bankruptcy on Friday. The logos were visible during the semifinal that took place on Thursday and the matches that were played earlier.

195.title: List shows batters who smashed most sixes in T20 World Cup 2022
195.article_body: Zimbabwe all-rounder Sikandar Raza smashed the most number of sixes (11) in T20 World Cup 2022. He is followed by England opener Alex Hales and Sri Lanka opener Kusal Mendis, who slammed 10 sixes each. Four batters, including India's Suryakumar Yadav, slammed nine sixes each, while five batters, including Virat Kohli and KL Rahul, slammed eight sixes each.

196.title: Bowlers have to take lot of credit: Stokes after Eng wins T20 WC 2022
196.article_body: After England won the T20 World Cup 2022 final, all-rounder Ben Stokes said the bowlers have to take "a lot of credit" as they restricted Pakistan to 137 runs. "In finals, especially chasing, you forgot all the hard work that came first," he added. Stokes scored an unbeaten 49-ball 52 to help England win the match by five wickets.

197.title: Congress announces 5th list of 6 candidates for Gujarat Assembly polls
197.article_body: Congress has released its fifth list of six candidates for the Gujarat Assembly polls. The party has fielded Chhattarsinh Gunjariya from Dhrangadhra constituency, Jayant Jerajbhai Patel from Morbi, Mansukhbhai Jadavbhai Kalariya from Rajkot West, Jivan Kumbharvadiya from Jamnagar Rural, Divyesh Manubhai Chavda from Gariadhar and Manhar Patel from Botad. Gujarat elections to be held in December.

198.title: Will cut migration from border villages: Uttarakhand CM Dhami
198.article_body: Uttarakhand CM Pushkar Singh Dhami said that the state government is committed to minimising migration from border villages as they serve as the second line of defence for the country. He added that the government will promote religious and adventure tourism to achieve this, since it will create self-employment opportunities for locals. Dhami inaugurated a 10-day Autumn Festival on Saturday.

199.title: US, Japan, S Korea 'more aligned than ever' on N Korea: Biden
199.article_body: US President Joe Biden on Sunday said that his country, Japan, and South Korea are "more aligned than ever" on North Korea's "provocative behaviour". Following this, US National Security Adviser Jake Sullivan said Biden, Japanese PM Fumio Kishida and South Korean President Yoon Suk-yeol had planned a joint response in case North Korea carries out further nuclear tests.

200.title: BYJU'S expects 3-fold growth in revenue in FY22: Byju Raveendran
200.article_body: BYJU'S expects to register a three-fold growth in revenue and losses to be halved in the financial year 2022, according to Founder and CEO Byju Raveendran. Speaking at Tech Sparks 2022, Raveendran said he sees potential for a million entrepreneurs in the country. He added that four of BYJU'S five integrations are seamlessly done and performing well.

201.title: Your real Twitter account sounds like a parody: Elon Musk to US Senator
201.article_body: Ed Markey, the US Senator for Massachusetts, took to Twitter to complain that a reporter was able to create a verified account impersonating him. Responding to his complaint, Twitter's new owner Elon Musk tweeted, "Perhaps it is because your real account sounds like a parody?" In another tweet, Musk said, "And why does your profile picture have a mask?"

202.title: No need to alter it: CPI(M) leader on rule on women's entry into Sabarimala
202.article_body: Menstruating women are not allowed into the Lord Ayyappa shrine at Sabarimala as he is an "eternal celibate" and there's no need to alter this practice, CPI(M) leader G Sudhakaran said. "It is something we all accept and respect," he said, adding that the minimum age for women to enter hasn't been changed from 60 years.

203.title: He showed he's best leg-spinner in world: Moeen on Rashid's performance vs Pak
203.article_body: England all-rounder Moeen Ali, speaking about Adil Rashid's bowling performance against Pakistan in the T20 World Cup 2022 final, has said, "He showed that he is the best leg-spinner in the world." Moeen stated that Rashid "bowled amazingly well" in the last two matches. Rashid scalped two wickets and conceded 22 runs against Pakistan in the final.

204.title: Proud of the team's efforts, it was just not our day: Naseem Shah
204.article_body: After losing to England in the T20 World Cup final, Pakistani pacer Naseem Shah said that he is proud of his team's efforts. "Couldn't end up on the winning side today but the love and support we got...was immense," Shah said. He added, "It was just not our day,  but we will come back stronger than ever."

205.title: Uganda confirms first Ebola case in country's east amid outbreak
205.article_body: Uganda's Health Ministry on Sunday said that a confirmed case of Ebola had been reported from Jinja city in the country's east. Health Minister Jane Ruth Aceng said the virus was detected in the body of a 45-year-old man who died on Thursday. Prior to this, cases due to the current Ebola outbreak had been confined to central Uganda.

206.title: Only BJP & Cong in Gujarat, never been a 3rd party: PM Modi's brother
206.article_body: Speaking about the prospects of AAP in Gujarat polls, PM Narendra Modi's brother Prahlad Modi said that there have only been two parties, BJP and Congress, in the state and never a third. "In the state of Gujarat, the Congress is now 'shunya' (nil) and the BJP has come to its full force," he added. Gujarat elections are in December.

207.title: Schools closed in TN's Mayiladuthurai tomorrow amid heavy rainfall
207.article_body: A holiday has been declared in all schools and colleges of Tamil Nadu's Mayiladuthurai district on November 14 in view of heavy rainfall, a senior official has announced. The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has also issued a red alert in several parts of the state. Chief Minister MK Stalin on Sunday conducted an inspection of the affected areas in Chennai.

208.title: Farah used to strip SRK to do ab check for 'Dard...': Om Shanti Om writer
208.article_body: 'Om Shanti Om' writer Mushtaq Shiekh, in his book 'The Making of Om Shanti Om', revealed Shah Rukh Khan refused to go shirtless for the film's song 'Dard-E-Disco' until he gets six-pack abs. Shiekh added Shah Rukh began working out to get the look. "Every week, Farah Khan (director) would strip Shah Rukh to do an ab check," he revealed.

209.title: Strong anti-incumbency wave against BJP in Gujarat: Ashok Gehlot
209.article_body: Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot said that Gujarat voters will teach BJP a lesson in the upcoming assembly elections as there's a strong anti-incumbency wave in the state. He added, "People have understood that the employment problem is terrible in the state." Gehlot, a senior AICC observer for the Gujarat elections, also said that people were "fed up with rising inflation".

210.title: FTX hit by rogue transactions; millions of dollars in assets removed
210.article_body: After cryptocurrency exchange FTX filed for bankruptcy in US, the company on Saturday said that it had detected unauthorised access to certain assets. Analysts had noticed "hundreds of millions of dollars of assets" were moved from the platform in "suspicious circumstances", Reuters reported. FTX's CEO John Ray said that the company was working with law enforcement to mitigate the problem.

211.title: 78-year-old female beggar raped in Bhopal; 1 arrested
211.article_body: A 78-year-old woman beggar was allegedly raped by a man in Bhopal, Madhya Pradesh. The 37-year-old accused used to sleep on a footpath, which was nearby the victim's hut, and had raped her last month, police said. The woman used to treat the accused like her son and used to give him food as well, police added.

212.title: Delhi Police issues traffic advisory for November 14-27 due to trade fair
212.article_body: Delhi Traffic Police (DTP) has issued a traffic advisory due to India International Trade Fair, which will be held at Pragati Maidan from November 14-27. Commuters are advised to avoid Mathura Road, Bhairon Marg, Ring Road, Shershah Road and Purana Quila Road due to traffic congestion, DTP said. Parking on Mathura Road and Bhairon Marg is prohibited, DTP added.

213.title: Richa Chadha to star in an Indo-British production
213.article_body: Actress Richa Chadha is set to play the lead role in an Indo-British production. The project, which will be helmed by a British director, will go on floors in January. Talking about the upcoming project, Richa said, "I've wanted to work outside of India, but I never pursued it actively till the opportunity presented itself...and I could not say no."

214.title: 99% Muslims in India are Hindustani by their ancestry: RSS leader
214.article_body: RSS leader Indresh Kumar on Sunday said 99% of the Muslim population in India is "Hindustani" by their ancestry, culture, traditions and motherland. "We must consider our duty towards our nation as supreme and above all other things as per the directives and tenets of the Holy Quran," he added. "All of us share the common DNA," Kumar further said.

215.title: MCD poll tickets sold for ₹2-3 cr, says AAP leader who climbed tower
215.article_body: AAP's former councillor Haseeb-ul-Hasan climbed an electricity tower on Sunday, miffed over being denied a ticket for the upcoming municipal polls and alleged that the party leaders had "sold" the tickets for ₹2-3 crore. He alleged that party leaders Atishi, Durgesh Pathak and Sanjay Singh will be responsible if he were to die, adding that they took his original documents.

216.title: Shoaib Akhtar responds to Mohammad Shami's 'karma' tweet using Harsha Bhogle's statement
216.article_body: Shoaib Akhtar responded to Mohammad Shami's 'karma' tweet using Harsha Bhogle's remark following Pakistan's defeat in T20 World Cup final. "Sorry brother...It's called karma," Shami had written responding to Akhtar's 'broken heart' emoji tweet. Sharing a picture of Bhogle's tweet wherein he praised Pakistan by calling them 'Best bowling team', Akhtar wrote, "This is what you call sensible tweet."

217.title: Pakistan can't win the T20 World Cup by just bowling: Mohammad Kaif
217.article_body: Former Indian cricketer Mohammad Kaif reacted to the T20 World Cup final's outcome by tweeting, "Lesson from this World T20: Pakistan can't win Cup by just bowling, India can't win Cup by just batting." He added, "England has batters, spinners, pacers, fielders, and luck." England beat Pakistan by 5 wickets on Sunday to win the T20 World Cup.

218.title: PM Modi to have 20 engagements during visit to Bali for G20 summit
218.article_body: PM Narendra Modi will reportedly have around 20 engagements during his nearly 45-hour stay in Indonesia's Bali for the G20 summit. He will leave for Bali on Monday. PM Modi will participate in key sessions on food and energy security, digital transformation, and health at the G20 summit, Foreign Secretary Vinay Kwatra had earlier said.

219.title: Chadwick was excited about introducing Talokan in Black Panther 2: Ryan
219.article_body: 'Black Panther: Wakanda Forever' director Ryan Coogler has revealed that late actor Chadwick Boseman was excited about introducing Talokan in the film. "I remember we were at a restaurant...the first time we talked about possibly having indigenous American representation in the film. He got the biggest smile, like, 'They're never going to see this coming'," Ryan added.

220.title: It's pro-India, but try to understand tragedy of Kashmir: Sudhir on 'Tanaav'
220.article_body: Sudhir Mishra has said 'Tanaav', the filmmaker's web show which follows a group of Indian intelligence agents tracking down a terrorist organisation in Kashmir, is "definitely pro-India". "But you also try and understand...tragedy of things in Kashmir. The innocent bystanders caught in the conflict as collateral damage," he added. 'Tanaav' is an adaptation of Israeli thriller series 'Fauda'.

221.title: IMF chief warns of risks to global economy from US-China rivalry
221.article_body: During an interview, International Monetary Fund (IMF) Managing Director Kristalina Georgieva warned of risks to the global economy from the rivalry between the United States and China. Georgieva said, "We may be sleepwalking into a world that is poorer and less secure as a result." She further described tariffs put on Chinese imports under then-US President Donald Trump as counterproductive.

222.title: Marathi TV actress Kalyani Jadhav dies after tractor knocks her down from 2-wheeler
222.article_body: Marathi TV actress Kalyani Kurale Jadhav was killed in a road accident on Saturday night. A tractor knocked her down from her two-wheeler near Kolhapur on Sangli-Kolhapur road, police said. The accident took place at around 11 pm. The 32-year-old actress had appeared in Marathi television serials like 'Tujhyat Jeev Rangala' and 'Dakkhancha Raja Jyotiba'.

223.title: How much prize money did each team get at T20 World Cup 2022?
223.article_body: Winners England received a total prize money of $1.74 million, which includes $140,000 bonus from Super 12 stage and $1.6 million for winning the tournament. Runners-up Pakistan won $920,000, while losing semi-finalists India and New Zealand received $560,000 and $540,000, respectively. Netherlands and Sri Lanka got a total of $230,000 each.

224.title: Shinde govt came into being due to corruption & fear: Cong's Patole
224.article_body: Maharashtra Congress chief Nana Patole on Sunday alleged that the Eknath Shinde-led government in the state came into existence because of corruption and out of fear. Patole added that the state cabinet wasn't being expanded because the government can collapse. "One cabinet minister is in charge of six districts. What is happening in Maharashtra?" he asked.

225.title: Iran criticises German Chancellor over his remarks on protests
225.article_body: Tehran on Sunday criticised German Chancellor Olaf Scholz for expressing support for anti-government protesters in Iran, and for backing the prospect of further EU sanctions against the Iranian government. He had also condemned Tehran's crackdown on the protests. Scholz's "provocative, interfering and undiplomatic" comments would cause "damage over the long term", Iran's Foreign Ministry said.

226.title: 'Pushpa 2' teaser to be shown before 'Avatar...' in theatres: Reports
226.article_body: The teaser of 'Pushpa: The Rule - Part 2' will be shown before the shows of 'Avatar: The Way of Water' in cinemas, according to reports. The James Cameron directorial will release on December 16. 'Pushpa: The Rule - Part 2', directed by Sukumar, stars Allu Arjun, Rashmika Mandanna and Fahadh Faasil, among others.

227.title: Sonam shares her pregnancy journey, says 'I don't have stretch marks'
227.article_body: Sonam Kapoor, who welcomed her child in August, took to Instagram Stories and shared her pregnancy journey. Sonam wrote she took the help of a book 'Gentle Birth Method' which is authored by Dr Gowri Motha "I've followed her blindly," she wrote. Sharing a picture of two products, Sonam wrote she doesn't have any stretch marks by using those products.

228.title: India should consider playing overseas T20 leagues for experience: Fleming
228.article_body: Ex-cricketer Stephen Fleming said that Indian players should consider playing in foreign T20 leagues to gain more exposure. "It seems like a number of these players who are playing around the world are getting really important experience," Fleming said. He added, "CPL (Caribbean Premier League)...becomes more important with the next World Cup being there (West Indies and United States)."

229.title: Production at Vedanta-Foxconn plant to begin within 2.5 years: Anil Agarwal
229.article_body: Vedanta Resources Chairman Anil Agarwal said production at its semiconductor and display manufacturing unit in Gujarat will start within two and a half years of the groundbreaking ceremony. Vedanta-Foxconn would invest ₹1,54,000 crore to install the facility, Chief Minister Bhupendra Patel had said after an MoU between the Gujarat government and a joint venture of the companies was signed earlier.

230.title: 4 JNU students barred from campus till inquiry into last week's violence is done
230.article_body: After last week's violence in JNU, four students have been barred from campus till an inquiry into the incident is completed. Two students were injured in a clash between two groups at the university on Wednesday night. Orders issued to the students state that anyone giving shelter to the four students on the university premises will invite strict disciplinary action.

231.title: Delay in expansion to ensure right partner for EV business: Ashok Leyland
231.article_body: Ashok Leyland Executive Chairman Dheeraj Hinduja said the company is in advanced discussions with investors for its electric vehicle business. He added that the delay was to ensure that the company has the right partner to support its growth plans. Hinduja said the company was also planning to launch electric vehicles under Switch Mobility in the Middle East.

232.title: Digital rupee critics missing the big picture: Zerodha Co-founder
232.article_body: Zerodha Co-founder Nikhil Kamath defended the digital rupee, saying that those critical of the Central bank Digital Currency (CBDC) might be missing the big picture. "Remittances, unbanked economy, and reducing subsidy leakage, to name a few," Kamath tweeted. "When anything new comes into the market, the old need to adapt, and the new need to regulate the change," he added.

233.title: Guj has better facilities for Vedanta-Foxconn plant over Maha: Anil Agarwal
233.article_body: Vedanta Chairman Anil Agarwal said that Gujarat was chosen over Maharashtra for the Vedanta-Foxconn plant because it was providing better facilities for the unit. Speaking at the HT Leadership Summit, he added, "The company will create a hub for manufacturing of iPhones and TV equipment at Maharashtra." Vedanta-Foxconn will invest ₹1,54,000 crore to set up the facility.

234.title: European energy crisis will benefit India's Reliance, Nayara: Report
234.article_body: Reliance Industries and Nayara Energy are expected to benefit from the ongoing energy crisis in Europe, according to a report, as these are among the Asian refiners that produce winter-specification diesel for the European Union. According to the report, since the Ukraine war began, Reliance and Nayara have imported almost 10 times more Russian crude from the pre-invasion levels.

235.title: Bahamas police interview FTX’s Bankman-Fried amid mystery outflows: Report
235.article_body: FTX’s Sam Bankman-Fried was interviewed by the Bahamian police and regulators on Saturday, Bloomberg reported. The questioning came a day after FTX had detected unauthorized access and analysts said about $662 million in tokens mysteriously flowed out of both FTX’s international and US exchanges. Bankman-Fried resigned as chief executive officer of FTX Group on Friday.

236.title: Maha man tricks daughter into writing suicide note blaming relatives, kills her
236.article_body: A 40-year-old man was arrested for tricking his 16-year-old daughter into writing a suicide note implicating his relatives, asking her to enact the extreme step and later killing her in Maharashtra. The accused told the deceased girl to tie a noose around her neck, clicked a picture and then kicked the stool, which led to her death, an official said.

237.title: India-US bilateral trade may reach $500-600 billion by 2030: Piyush Goyal
237.article_body: Commerce and Industry Minister Piyush Goyal said he believes that bilateral trade between India and the US will reach $500-600 billion by 2030. Speaking on whether India will join the Indo-Pacific Economic Framework for Prosperity, Goyal said it depends on what India will get in return. The US looks at India as its friend and a trusted partner, he added.

238.title: Adani Group open offer to buy 26% stake in NDTV to launch on Nov 22
238.article_body: Adani Group on Friday announced that its open offer to buy an additional 26% public shareholding in NDTV will open for subscription from November 22. The offer for acquiring 1.67 crore equity shares at an offer price of ₹294/share will tentatively close on December 5, a regulatory filing showed. The Adani group acquired a 29.18% stake in NDTV in August.

239.title: Sajid Khan, Shiv Thakare used me as vote bank in Bigg Boss: Nagori
239.article_body: Bigg Boss 16 contestant Gori Nagori, who was recently eliminated from the show, said co-contestant Shiv Thakare was using her. "For him and even Sajid Khan, we were only vote banks. If you call us friends, behave like one. But they always looked down upon us," she added. She further called Sajid, MC Stan and Sumbul Touqeer Khan weak contestants.

240.title: Well done: Sitharaman on seizure of 61 kg gold by Mumbai Customs
240.article_body: After Mumbai Airport's Customs officials seized 61 kg of gold worth ₹32 crore, Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said, "Appreciate Mumbai Customs for your alertness." "Your timely action has borne a stunning outcome. Well done," Sitharaman added. "This was the highest-ever seizure in a single day. Seven passengers were arrested," Customs officials said in a statement.

241.title: Anyone casting evil eye on India is given befitting reply: Rajnath
241.article_body: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh has said that safeguarding national interests is the main focus of the BJP-led central government. He said that anyone casting an evil eye on India is now given a befitting reply, adding, "India is no longer weak." Referring to the 2016 surgical strikes and 2019 Balakot airstrikes, he said "soldiers have proved this time and again".

242.title: Army chief Gen Manoj Pande embarks on 4-day visit to France
242.article_body: Indian Army chief General Manoj Pande on Sunday embarked on a four-day visit to France where he will meet the French military leadership. The visit is aimed at enhancing India-France defence ties, the Indian Army said. General Pande will also lay a wreath at the Neuve-Chapelle Indian Memorial, which commemorates the sacrifices of 4,742 Indian soldiers during World War 1.

243.title: List of most polluted cities in India today released
243.article_body: As per the Central Pollution Control Board's latest data, Bihar's Motihari is the most polluted city in India today, with an AQI of 413. It's followed by Purnia (378), Bettiah (377), Siwan (372), Araria (340), Katihar (337), Saharsa (322), Samastipur (317), Darbhanga (316),  Buxar (313), Hisar (311), Fatehabad (306), Delhi (303) and Singrauli (302). Only Motihari is in 'severe' category.

244.title: Video shows the moment explosion occurred at Istanbul's busy pedestrian street
244.article_body: A video has surfaced on social media showing the moment when an explosion occurred on Istanbul's popular pedestrian street, Istiklal Avenue, that left people dead and injured. The video showed flames erupting and a loud bang, as pedestrians turned and ran away. Other footage showed ambulances, fire trucks and police at the scene of the explosion.

245.title: 42, including 25 students, injured as bus falls into gorge in J&K
245.article_body: As many as 25 students were among the 42 passengers injured in a road accident in Jammu and Kashmir's Rajouri district. The driver lost control of the vehicle and it fell into the roadside gorge. The injured persons were evacuated to a nearby hospital and five of them were later shifted to GMC Jammu for advanced treatment, officials said.

246.title: Siddhaanth's wife shares their first-ever pic together after actor's death, pens note
246.article_body: Alesia Raut, the wife of actor Siddhaanth Vir Surryavanshi who passed away at 46 while working out at a gym, took to Instagram on Sunday to share their first picture together from 2017. Raut wrote, "I love you and always will love you till I am alive." She added, "I know you will be always guiding me as an angel."

247.title: Curran 1st cricketer to win Player of the Final, Player of the Tournament awards in a T20 WC
247.article_body: England pacer Sam Curran on Sunday created history by becoming the first cricketer to win Player of the Final and Player of the Tournament in a single edition of T20 World Cup. Curran bagged Player of the Final award after taking three wickets against Pakistan in T20 World Cup 2022 final. He bagged the tournament award for taking 13 wickets.

248.title: J&K is victim of Centre's wrong policies: Cong leader Ghulam Mir
248.article_body: Congress leader Ghulam Ahmad Mir said that Jammu and Kashmir is a victim of the Centre's "wrong policies". "Only Congress is capable enough to defeat the divisive and anti-people policies of the BJP," Mir said. He added, "The tall claims about the development of J&K, fake narrative built up...[is] reflecting the absolute failures...of the BJP government on all fronts."

249.title: Explosion occurs on busy pedestrian street in Istanbul, several injured
249.article_body: An explosion took place on a busy pedestrian street in Turkey's Istanbul, with several people reported to be injured. A video has surfaced online showing ambulances, fire trucks and police at the scene in Istiklal Avenue. The video also showed flames erupting, with pedestrians running away. The cause of the explosion is not yet clear.

250.title: Rapid growth of urbanisation not matched by urban infra development: RBI
250.article_body: In a report on Municipal Finances, RBI said that the rapid growth of urbanisation in India has not been accompanied by a corresponding increase in urban infrastructure. It said, "[This] is reflected in the performance of the urban local bodies, especially municipal corporations (MCs)." "MCs' committed expenditure in the form of establishment expenses...but capital expenditure is minimal," it said.

251.title: Not possible: Rajiv Gandhi assassination convict Nalini on meeting Gandhis
251.article_body: After her release from prison on Saturday, Nalini Sriharan, a convict in former PM Rajiv Gandhi's assassination, said that it wasn't possible to meet the Gandhi family. Furthermore, she said that she felt "very sorry" when asked about her message for the Gandhis and the families of those who were killed. "They have lost their dear ones," Nalini said.

252.title: 11 charged over killing of Iranian militia member during unrest
252.article_body: Eleven people, including one woman, have been indicted over the killing of a Basij militia force member during anti-hijab protests in Iran, state media reported on Saturday. Among those indicted, some were charged with "corruption on earth", which carries the death penalty. The activist HRANA news agency said 336 protesters had been killed in the unrest as of Friday.

253.title: Sister's kidney was best match: Tejashwi on transplant for father Lalu
253.article_body: Ailing RJD supremo Lalu Prasad Yadav's son and Bihar Deputy CM Tejashwi Yadav, while talking about his sister's decision of donating a kidney to their father, on Sunday said, "My sister's (Rohini Acharya) kidney turned out to be the best match." "The doctors wanted someone from the family to donate a kidney to my father," Tejashwi added.

254.title: Raveena shares old pics with Juhi on latter's birthday, pens note
254.article_body: Actress Raveena Tandon took to Instagram on Sunday to wish Juhi Chawla on the occasion of her 55th birthday. Sharing a series of old pictures with Juhi, she wrote, "Happy birthday my darling Ju." "May your infectious laughter, lighten up our days always! Many many years of love and happiness," Raveena added.

255.title: WB couple, child lodged in jail on suspicion of being Bangladeshi infiltrators
255.article_body: A West Bengal couple, along with their one-and-a-half-year-old child, has been reportedly lodged in a Bengaluru jail for over three months on suspicion of being Bangladeshi infiltrators. The couple got employment at a waste segregation unit in Karnataka's Sulibele village, their relatives said. But they were arrested within a month, they added.

256.title: All Pak pacers can bowl 140 plus, bowling attack better than India: Jaffer
256.article_body: Former Indian batter Wasim Jaffer said that the Pakistani bowling attack is better than the Indian attack. "[In] the fast bowling, they have got Shaheen Shah Afridi, Haris Rauf and Naseem Shah and they all bowl 140 plus. Rauf can easily touch 150 and he is bowling really well," Jaffer said. He added, "[Indian] bowling looks weaker than our batting."

257.title: When I got my first paycheck, I bought groceries for the house: Rajkummar
257.article_body: Actor Rajkummar Rao has revealed that his first paycheck was ₹300, which he got when he was in the eighth standard. He added that he used to give dance tuitions to a girl at her house. "When I earned my first ₹300, I went to buy groceries for...house. And I bought small quantities of everything," Rajkummar said.

258.title: Electricity supply to be cut if consumers don't pay bills for 3 months: BESCOM
258.article_body: Bangalore Electricity Supply Company Limited (BESCOM) on Friday said that if a consumer does not pay the electricity bill for three consecutive months, action will be initiated to cancel the electricity supply contract. The consumer will then have to apply for a new electricity connection, BESCOM added. Meanwhile, BESCOM has asked consumers to not pay their bills online this month.

259.title: China's daily COVID-19 cases cross 14,000
259.article_body: Coronavirus cases are rising in China as the daily case count on Saturday rose to 14,288, up from a nationwide tally of 11,323 on Friday. China's daily COVID-19 cases have stayed above 10,000 since breaching that level last week for the first time since April. Guangdong, Henan, Beijing, Chongqing and Inner Mongolia remain the places with the most COVID-19 outbreaks.

260.title: Banned PFI's absconding student wing leader arrested in Bengaluru
260.article_body: A leader of the student wing of banned Popular Front of India (PFI) was arrested in Bengaluru on Friday night and taken to Guwahati on Sunday, police said. The absconding leader, Amir Hamza, was hiding with some families from Tripura. A search operation was conducted at Hamza's residence and incriminating documents and posters against BJP, RSS and ABVP were recovered.

261.title: BBMP proposes white-topping 39 B'luru roads at a cost of ₹1,449 cr
261.article_body: The Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) has sought approval from the government to white-top 39 more roads, at an estimated cost of ₹1,449 crore, officials said. Among the key roads that will be white-topped are the Outer Ring Road (ORR) from Silk Board to KR Puram, Indiranagar Double Road, Indiranagar 12th Main Road and Kammanahalli Main Road, among others.

262.title: Mumbai passengers won't be fined for not wearing seat belts till Nov 15
262.article_body: After facing criticism for enforcing penalties on motorists without conducting awareness drives, the Mumbai Traffic Police has temporarily paused the seatbelt action, which was to be implemented from November 1. We made people aware of seat belts in the first ten days and now action will be taken against those not wearing them from November 15 onwards.

263.title: Hot air balloon crashes twice in Austrian Alps; 9 injured
263.article_body: A hot air balloon crashed twice in the Austrian Alps on Saturday, injuring nine people, authorities said. The pilot and co-pilot, along with two passengers, reportedly fell off the carriage during a hard landing. Following this, the balloon took off again with its five remaining passengers and landed after the pilot passed instructions for an emergency landing to the passengers.

264.title: Explosion causes cracks on Udaipur railway track, train services suspended
264.article_body: An explosion took place on a newly-opened railway line in Rajasthan's Udaipur on Sunday, hours before the Asarwa-Udaipur express train was supposed to pass, police said. The movement of trains was suspended after officials were alerted by local residents, who spotted cracks on the railway track. "We have found some explosives on the track," a senior police officer said.

265.title: 3 rob passengers in moving bus at knifepoint in Delhi; arrested
265.article_body: Three men were arrested for allegedly robbing passengers in a moving bus in Delhi's Kalyanpuri area, police said on Saturday. The accused, who were carrying knives and daggers, snatched phones and wallets from all the passengers while the driver was asked to continue on the same route. The accused were identified with the help of technical surveillance, an officer said.

266.title: 2 arrested for taking away goods worth ₹77 lakh from saree shop in Thane
266.article_body: Two persons were arrested for allegedly taking away goods worth ₹77 lakh from a saree shop which they ran in partnership with a businessman in Thane, Maharashtra. The accused were arrested from Parbhani with the help of the CCTV footage and intelligence inputs, police said. Several items, including sarees, a computer and a printer, were recovered from the accused.

267.title: Mumbai airport Customs seize 61 kg gold worth ₹32 cr, biggest 1-day seizure
267.article_body: In the biggest one-day seizure, Mumbai airport's Customs officials seized 61 kg of gold worth ₹32 crore in two different cases and arrested seven passengers. In the first case, four passengers were arrested for concealing gold bars in specially designed waist belts with multiple pockets. In the second case, three passengers were arrested with around eight kg of gold.

268.title: Rajnath defends India's G20 logo, says 'Lotus is symbol of India's heritage'
268.article_body: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh said that the lotus is not just BJP's logo, but was also declared the national flower in 1950 since it's a symbol of India's heritage. The use of the symbol was criticised by Opposition parties, and Singh said that the row was unnecessary. "Should we forget that the lotus flower is a national symbol?" he asked.

269.title: Sorry brother, it's called karma: Shami to Akhtar as Pakistan lose T20 WC 2022 final
269.article_body: Team India fast bowler Mohammad Shami responded to former Pakistan fast bowler Shoaib Akhtar's tweet wherein he posted a 'broken heart' emoji following Pakistan's defeat in T20 World Cup 2022 final against England. "Sorry brother...It is called karma," Shami wrote. Earlier, Akhtar had mocked India for not taking a single wicket in their semi-final match against England.

270.title: India International Trade Fair to begin tomorrow in Delhi
270.article_body: The 41st edition of the annual India International Trade Fair will begin on Monday at Delhi's Pragati Maidan. Over 2,000 exhibitors will participate in the "Vocal for Local, Local to Global" themed 14-day fair. While the event is reserved for business visitors from November 14-18, it will open for general public from November 19-27 from 10 am to 7:30 pm.

271.title: Shadab Khan breaks record for taking most wickets for Pakistan in T20I cricket
271.article_body: Leg-spinner Shadab Khan on Sunday broke the record for taking most wickets for Pakistan in T20I cricket. With his one wicket in the T20 World Cup 2022 final against England, Shadab took his tally of wickets for Pakistan in T20I cricket to 98. He overtook Shahid Afridi, who took 97 wickets for Pakistan in T20I cricket.

272.title: Man sets shop, vehicles on fire in Gurugram for being kicked out of Satsang
272.article_body: A man was booked for allegedly torching a furniture shop and two vehicles in New Basti in Gurugram's Sector 8. The incident happened after the accused, Harish, was slapped and kicked out of a Satsang (religious gathering) for arriving there in an inebriated state, police said. Notably, the furniture shop was owned by the organiser of the Satsang, Parmeshwar Kumar.

273.title: Factory worker dies after colleague pumps air into rectum for fun in UP
273.article_body: A 47-year-old factory worker died after his colleague allegedly inserted an air compressor pipe into his rectum 'for fun' in UP's Kanpur on Friday. The deceased fell unconscious after the pipe, which is used to clean dust, was inserted into his rectum. Rania Police Station in-charge Atul Gautam said that the victim died of excessive internal bleeding.

274.title: Siddhaanth & I stopped talking, I regret not calling him: Neha Marda after actor's death
274.article_body: Days after television actor Siddhaanth Vir Surryavanshi passed away at 46 while working out at the gym, his co-star Neha Marda told ETimes, "I am feeling so bad that after we had a disagreement over something, we stopped talking to each other." She added, "Now I regret not calling him. Had I made that call, we would've been friends again."

275.title: England become first-ever team to hold both ODI and T20 World Cups at the same time
275.article_body: England have become the first-ever team to hold both ODI and T20 World Cups at the same time. England, who won the T20 World Cup 2022 today after defeating Pakistan in the final, are also the defending ODI world champions having won ODI World Cup in 2019. England had beaten New Zealand in the 2019 final.

276.title: Ben Stokes smashes fifty in T20I cricket for the first time ever
276.article_body: England all-rounder Ben Stokes on Sunday smashed his T20I career's first-ever fifty. The 31-year-old scored an unbeaten 52 off 49 deliveries to help his team defeat Pakistan in the T20 World Cup 2022 final. Stokes hit five fours and a six in his knock. His previous highest score in T20I cricket was 47*(30), which came against South Africa in 2020.

277.title: Who is Nishad Singh, a core team member of the now-bankrupt FTX?
277.article_body: Nishad Singh worked as the Director of Engineering at FTX, the US crypto exchange that filed for bankruptcy. He was reportedly a part of FTX's 30-year-old Founder Sam Bankman-Fried's inner circle that lived in a luxury penthouse in the Bahamas. Singh, who previously worked at Facebook, Alameda Research and Berkeley Consulting, did his BSc from the University of California, Berkeley.

278.title: No actor wanted to work with us during 'Maine Pyar...': Sooraj Barjatya
278.article_body: Filmmaker Sooraj Barjatya revealed that no actor wanted to work with his company Rajshri Productions while he was making 'Maine Pyar Kiya'. "Our last few films were a flop...we were suffering financially...one day, I met a young man who we'd rejected after his first screen test. But there was something about him...That man was Salman Khan," he added.

279.title: West trying to militarise Southeast Asia: Russian Foreign Minister
279.article_body: Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov on Sunday accused the West of seeking to militarise Southeast Asia in a bid to contain Russian and Chinese interests. This comes ahead of the Bali G20 summit of state leaders where the Russian delegation led by Lavrov will come face-to-face with Western leaders, the first such meeting since the beginning of the Ukraine war.

280.title: Serial liar, says BJP on Rahul's privatisation of 150 railway stations remark
280.article_body: Press Information Bureau (PIB) fact-checked Congress leader Rahul Gandhi's claims that the Central government has privatised over 150 railway stations in the country and called the claims "completely bogus". Responding to the development, BJP leader Shehzad Poonawalla said, "Rahul Gandhi is a serial liar and this is not the first time that he has been caught with his lies."

281.title: England defeat Pakistan to win T20 World Cup after 12 years, equal West Indies' record
281.article_body: England defeated Pakistan by five wickets in the T20 World Cup 2022 final in Melbourne to win T20 World Cup after 12 years. England restricted Pakistan to 137/8 in 20 overs and went on to chase down the target in 19 overs. With this, England have equalled West Indies' record for winning most T20 World Cup titles (two).

282.title: Varun is the most enthusiastic person I've ever met: 'Bhediya' director
282.article_body: 'Bhediya' director Amar Kaushik said in an interview that actor Varun Dhawan is the most curious and enthusiastic person he has ever met. "Not just in the industry, but in my entire life. He's the first person to call me every morning...He'll constantly ask questions about his character, like - 'Can we do this, can we do that'," Amar added.

283.title: Manjima Mohan-Gautham Karthik to get married on Nov 28: Report
283.article_body: Actors Manjima Mohan and Gautham Karthik, who made their relationship official on October 31 via an Instagram post, are reportedly getting married on November 28 this year. The wedding will reportedly take place in Chennai. As per a report, the couple will also host a reception in Ooty and Chennai for their friends and colleagues after the wedding.

284.title: Dimple Yadav to file nomination for Mainpuri bypolls tomorrow: Report
284.article_body: Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav's wife Dimple Yadav is likely to file her nomination papers for Mainpuri bypolls on Monday, senior party leader Alok Shakya said. The Mainpuri bypolls will be held on December 5 and the result will be declared on December 8. Notably, Mainpuri Lok Sabha seat fell vacant following the demise of Mulayam Singh Yadav in October.

285.title: 3 people rob 18-year-old of jewellery worth ₹18 lakh in Mumbai, booked
285.article_body: Three people have been booked for allegedly stealing diamond jewellery worth ₹18 lakh from an 18-year-old man in Mumbai. They posed as priests and asked the victim to buy flowers for puja. When he ignored them, one of them asked him to make five rounds on that path as a punishment. They then ran away with the jewellery.

286.title: 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' revealed real identity of Rahul Gandhi: Kanhaiya Kumar
286.article_body: Congress leader Kanhaiya Kumar hailed the party's "Bharat Jodo Yatra" and said that the march revealed the real identity of MP Rahul Gandhi. "Women are also meeting Rahul Gandhi comfortably during the yatra…The first leg of [yatra] has been completed and the second stage of the journey will be based on the unfulfilled promises of the BJP government," said Kanhaiya.

287.title: Robbers open fire and loot ₹25 lakh from courier office in Pune
287.article_body: A gang of robbers opened fire and looted ₹25 lakh from a courier office in Pune's Market Yard area on Saturday, the police said. CCTV footage showed that five men barged into the office and one of them broke the building's glass exterior and fired a round in the ground. "We have formed teams to trace them," an official said.

288.title: 'Metaverse' theme park to be built near 'Statue of Prosperity' in Bengaluru
288.article_body: Karnataka minister Ashwath Narayan confirmed that the government is building a new "metaverse" theme park near the "Statue of Prosperity" to attract tourism. "The...park would have tiny lakes, cultural symbols...and 'metaverse' experiences to depict rich heritage and tech prowess...[It] will be integrated with sacred soil and water, collected from various villages of Karnataka," said Narayan.

289.title: Priyanka Gandhi questioned me about her father's killing in jail, cried: Nalini Sriharan
289.article_body: Nalini Sriharan, one of the convicts freed in former Prime Minister Rajiv Gandhi's assassination case on Saturday, said that Priyanka Gandhi Vadra met her in the Vellore Central Prison in 2008 and asked about the killing of her father. "She got emotional for her father. She cried too," said Sriharan. She added that she told Priyanka Gandhi whatever she knew.

290.title: Shehzad Poonawalla shares 'Lootera' poster, says 'How AAP looted Delhi'
290.article_body: Bharatiya Janata Party's Shehzad Poonawalla took to Twitter to share a poster with Delhi Deputy Chief Minister Manish Sisodia's picture on a bike. 'Lootera' can be seen written on top of the poster. "How AAP looted Delhi," Poonawalla wrote on Twitter. He also shared the poster at a press conference earlier today.

291.title: Polling party suspended after EVMs found in private vehicle amid Himachal Pradesh polls
291.article_body: A polling party has been suspended after it was allegedly caught transporting Electronic Voting Machines in a private vehicle by Congress workers in Himachal Pradesh's Rampur amid state Assembly elections. "We found...Polling Party No.146 was carrying EVM/VVPAT machine in a private vehicle...and prima facie found the party has not followed due procedures," Returning Officer Surender Mohan said.

292.title: 100% false: Twitter's ex-employee as Musk calls Twitter 'biggest click driver'
292.article_body: A former Twitter employee denied Elon Musk's claim of Twitter driving a massive number of clicks to other websites/apps and being the "biggest click driver on the internet". Claire Diaz-Ortiz, who worked at Twitter for over five years, tweeted, "Lies...This is 100% false & Twitter knows it." She added, "Twitter is much lower on traffic than Facebook and LinkedIn."

293.title: Prankster 'Rahul Ligma' fakes to be fired by FTX after Twitter; video goes viral
293.article_body: The prankster who uses the name 'Rahul Ligma' and made some media persons believe that he was a fired Twitter employee a couple of weeks ago, has now faked being fired by troubled crypto exchange FTX. In a video, he said, "It is really tough. This is my second job in a month." He added, "Everything just changed so quickly."

294.title: Don't know how well he knew Siddhaanth: Rajev on Vivek's 'hyper-gymming' remark
294.article_body: Rajev Paul, reacting to Vivek Agnihotri's "hyper-gymming" remark following Siddhaanth Vir Surryavanshi's demise, said the actor was "very careful of his diet". "I don't know how well [Vivek] knew him," he added. Mourning his demise, Vivek tweeted, "Mad rush to build aggressive body without any medical advice is so dangerous. Hyper-Gymming is a relatively new phenomenon...It needs to be regulated."

295.title: Faked stomach ache to help Padmini run away & get married: Mithun
295.article_body: Actor Mithun Chakraborty shared that he helped actress Padmini Kolhapure to run away and get married to producer Pradeep Sharma. "I faked a stomach ache in front of everyone so that she could run away, get married and come back," Mithun recalled, adding that he continued to act till Padmini didn't return to the sets. Padmini married Pradeep in 1986.

296.title: Promised ₹500, got ₹200 to attend PM's rally in K'taka: Group
296.article_body: A group of people, including labourers, staged a protest in Karnataka's Chikkaballapur district on Saturday alleging that a local BJP leader paid them ₹200 each for attending PM Narendra Modi's rally near Bengaluru. They claimed they were promised ₹500. Police said the issue was resolved amicably after local leaders met them and addressed their concerns.

297.title: Chinese military flew 36 fighter jets and bombers near island: Taiwan
297.article_body: The Taiwanese Defence Ministry claimed the Chinese military flew 36 fighter jets and bombers near Taiwan. On Saturday, ten of the aircraft flew across the median line in the Taiwan Strait which separates the island from the mainland. Taiwan also claimed it spotted four Chengdu J-10 fighters, a Y-8 antisubmarine warfare plane and three H-6 bombers southwest of the island.

298.title: Have to dismantle what we made: Akshay on Bollywood films not performing
298.article_body: Actor Akshay Kumar, speaking about the poor performance of Bollywood films, has said, "We have to dismantle what we have made." He added that the viewers' choices have changed "rapidly" after the pandemic. "It is our fault, it is not the audiences' fault that they are not coming (to theatres). We have to give them what they want," he added.

299.title: FPIs invest nearly ₹19,000 crore in equities in November as dollar weakens
299.article_body: Foreign investors have invested ₹18,979 crore in Indian equities so far in November, data with the depositories showed, amid moderating trend in the US inflation and softening of the dollar. The net outflow was at just ₹8 crore last month and at ₹7,624 crore in September. The total FPIs outflow in equities has reached ₹1.5 lakh crore in 2022.

300.title: Punjab bans public display of arms, songs glorifying violence to fight gun culture
300.article_body: The Punjab government issued an order on Sunday banning the public display of arms, both online and offline. Songs glorifying violence were also banned. Weapon licenses issued so far will be reviewed within three months and no license will be issued unless the District Collector is satisfied. Further, celebratory firing that can endanger lives will be punishable.

301.title: Man collapses while dancing, dies of heart attack in Raj; video surfaces
301.article_body: A 42-year-old man died of a heart attack after he collapsed while dancing at a marriage ceremony in the Pali district of Rajasthan. A video of the incident, which has surfaced on social media, shows the man happily dancing before he suddenly collapses on stage and dies. His family members took him to a hospital, where doctors declared him dead.

302.title: France confirms Iran has detained another 2 of its citizens
302.article_body: The French Foreign Ministry on Saturday confirmed news reports about two French citizens being held in Iran, without giving further details. On Friday, the newspaper Le Figaro reported that two French nationals had been arrested in Iran prior to the start of anti-hijab protests in September. This brings the total number of French nationals being detained in Iran to seven.

303.title: Sembcorp Industries to acquire Vector Green Energy for ₹2,780 crore
303.article_body: Sembcorp Industries announced that its wholly-owned subsidiary Sembcorp Green Infra will acquire Vector Green Energy for ₹2,780 crore to expand its renewable energy portfolio in India to 3GW. The acquisition will be funded through internal cash resources and external borrowings. The completion of the acquisition will bring the group's gross renewable energy capacity to 8.5GW.

304.title: October retail inflation to be below 7%: RBI Governor Shaktikanta Das
304.article_body: Reserve Bank of India (RBI) Governor Shaktikanta Das said that retail inflation in October is expected to remain below 7% as the union government and central bank have taken various measures. In September, the retail inflation rate was 7.41% and in August it was 7%. To tackle inflation, the RBI has raised the repo rate three times since May.

305.title: AAP is a failed political startup: Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma
305.article_body: Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma criticised AAP, saying that the party is a failed political startup. He claimed that the AAP has not progressed as it has been trying to sell the same product for the last 10 years without any proof. "Even after 10 years, they haven’t progressed to become an MSME (Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises)," said Sarma.

306.title: Ayodhya mosque construction likely to be completed by Dec 2023: Trust
306.article_body: The Indo-Islamic Cultural Foundation has said that the construction of the mosque in Ayodhya is expected to be completed by December 2023. The construction of all proposed structures, including a hospital, library, community kitchen and research centre, will start simultaneously but the mosque is likely to be completed first because of its small size, the trust's secretary told PTI.

307.title: I want to reduce my fees by 30% to 40%: Akshay Kumar on reducing cost of movie outing
307.article_body: Addressing ways to bring down the cost of movie outing, actor Akshay Kumar said there are many things that can be done by actors, producers and theatres. "I want to bring down my fees by 30% to 40%," he stated. "We've to work on the cost of me, the cost of making film. Everything needs to be addressed," he added.

308.title: Mumbai woman pays ₹60 lakh to astrologer to get 'complete control' over husband; 2 booked
308.article_body: Mumbai Police have booked an astrologer and another man for allegedly cheating a 38-year-old woman of nearly ₹60 lakh under the pretext of helping her take "complete control" over her businessman husband through 'black magic'. The woman had met the astrologer on Instagram. Police said that her former boyfriend mediated between her and the astrologer.

309.title: Voted for Tharoor so that manipulators like Assam CM are never promoted: Cong leader
309.article_body: Congress leader Sandeep Dikshit on Sunday said that he voted for Shashi Tharoor in the recently concluded party Presidential polls, to ensure that people like Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma are not promoted. His comments came a day after CM Sarma said that he expects those who voted for Tharoor in the elections to join BJP soon.

310.title: Are you serious?: Namita to Twitter user who called Shark Tank just a 'show'
310.article_body: Shark Tank India judge Namita Thapar responded to a Twitter user who ridiculed the show and tweeted, "Mam TRP bhi kuch hota hai (Madam, there's something called TRP)…It's a show, not a real investors pitch!" Thapar responded, "Are you serious? Because it's my 'real' money I'm putting in." She added, "What do you mean by it's not a real pitch?"

311.title: Direct flight from Pune to Bangkok launched, to operate 4 days a week
311.article_body: Union Minister of Civil Aviation Jyotiraditya Scindia on Saturday inaugurated a direct flight from Pune to Bangkok. The SpiceJet's flight will operate between Pune-Bangkok-Pune four days a week on every Tuesday, Thursday, Saturday and Sunday. Scindia said that this air connectivity will encourage the bilateral exchange between India and Thailand in the domain of trade, education and investment.

312.title: Bengaluru airport's T2 will be operational after 30-45 days
312.article_body: Kempegowda International Airport's CEO Hari Marar on Saturday said that Terminal 2 of the Bengaluru airport was equipped to handle at least 25 million flyers annually. Speaking just a day after PM Narendra Modi inaugurated the new terminal, Marar said that the terminal would only be operational after 30 or 45 days. Security sweeps have to be done, Marar added.

313.title: Sam Curran records best bowling figures by a fast bowler in a T20 World Cup final
313.article_body: England fast bowler Sam Curran on Sunday recorded the best bowling figures by a fast bowler in a T20 World Cup final. The 24-year-old took three wickets for 12 runs in his four-over spell against Pakistan in the T20 World Cup 2022 final in Melbourne. Curran took a total of 13 wickets in T20 World Cup 2022.

314.title: Was called Salman's brother, Malaika's husband, it used to bother me: Arbaaz
314.article_body: Actor-filmmaker Arbaaz Khan said in an interview that when he was called Salman Khan's brother and Malaika Arora's husband, it used to bother him. "But, you know, I guess there are things that you can't change," he added. "There's no point changing people's mindset...the exercise of proving things to people is such a futile exercise," said Arbaaz.

315.title: Wanted to be Bruce Lee & do what he used to do: Akshay Kumar
315.article_body: Akshay Kumar said he "wanted to be Bruce Lee" and explained how martial arts helped him in his acting career. "I just wanted to do what he used to do," Akshay said, adding that he calls himself a "stuntman first, actor next". Addressing why Hindi films are failing at box office, Akshay stated that Bollywood needs to "dismantle" and "reinvent".

316.title: Akshay wanted ₹90 cr for 'Hera Pheri 3', Kartik asked for ₹30 cr: Report
316.article_body: Producer Firoz Nadiadwala reportedly discussed 'Hera Pheri 3' simultaneously with actors Akshay Kumar and Kartik Aaryan. "Akshay quoted ₹90 crore...plus some share of profit as his remuneration...whereas Kartik was willing to do it for ₹30 crore", a source said. "Film was fetching...₹15 crore lesser from satellite...digital players for Kartik as compared to Akshay," the source added.

317.title: Malaika is strict, I'm an indulgent father: Arbaaz on son Arhaan
317.article_body: Actor-filmmaker Arbaaz Khan opened up about his and ex-wife Malaika Arora's parenting approach towards their son Arhaan Khan. Calling himself "a little indulgent as a father", Arbaaz said that Malaika is "a good mother", who is "strict but friendly". "I pamper Arhaan...I just want to see him get everything he wants and be happy," Arbaaz shared.

318.title: Set up dedicated dengue hospitals in each district in UP: CM Yogi
318.article_body: Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath on Saturday issued directives for opening dedicated dengue hospitals in each district in the state amid a rise in cases. Yogi said this during a high-level review meeting with the state health department authorities. He added that facilities for platelet and dengue testing should also be available in every district of the state.

319.title: Man's warning triggers evacuation of building before collapse in France
319.article_body: A four-storey building in the French city of Lille was evacuated before dawn on Saturday, hours before it collapsed in the morning hours, authorities informed. The building was evacuated after a man returning home at 3 am alerted emergency services about cracks appearing in the structure, authorities said. A person who was rescued from the rubble sustained only light injuries.

320.title: It's humiliation: Locals as PCMC seizes movable assets of tax defaulters
320.article_body: Locals have described the Pimpri-Chinchwad Municipal Corporation's (PCMC) decision of confiscating movable assets of property tax defaulters as a "public humiliation" of citizens. Ex-chief of the PCMC standing committee Seema Savale said, "This decision...to seize the TV, fridge and vehicles of tax defaulters is wrong itself." Over 8,000 defaulters face the prospect of losing movable property.

321.title: Man arrested for raping 9-year-old girl in MP; minor's condition critical
321.article_body: The Madhya Pradesh Police arrested a 32-year-old man for allegedly kidnapping and raping a nine-year-old girl in Indore. The incident took place when the girl was sleeping with her parents in a small hut-like structure at a construction site. According to the police, the victim has been admitted to a hospital and her condition is stated to be critical.

322.title: Uttarakhand revokes production ban on Baba Ramdev's 5 products, calls it an ‘error’
322.article_body: Uttarakhand Ayurveda and Unani Licensing Authority on Saturday revoked its order of ban on production of five products from Baba Ramdev's Divya Pharmacy. "We issued...previous order hastily and it was an error," Uttarakhand drug regulator Dr GCS Jangpangi said. The state authority had ordered a ban on production of BPgrit, Madhugrit, Thyrogrit, Lipidom and Eyegrit Gold tablets.

323.title: Unidentified person kills 35-year-old man inside his house in Ghaziabad
323.article_body: An unidentified person killed a 35-year-old man by slashing his throat inside his house in the wee hours of Saturday in Ghaziabad. "There were noises heard by neighbours from the victim's house. [Victim's wife] saw an assailant run away through the terrace of the house. [The victim] was lying dead in a pool of blood," said SP of Ghaziabad (rural).

324.title: PM Modi not just a 'feku master' but 'U-turn ustad': Congress
324.article_body: Congress' Jairam Ramesh on Sunday said that PM Narendra Modi is not just a "feku master", but a "U-turn ustad". His comments came after the Centre filed an affidavit in the SC, emphasising the benefits of the National Food Security Act (NFSA). PM Modi, when he was the CM of Gujarat, had said that the bill would raise hunger issues.

325.title: 19-year-old biker falls 40 feet from a bridge, dies in Mumbai
325.article_body: A 19-year-old man died after he allegedly lost control of his bike and fell 40 feet from a bridge in Mumbai. A police officer said that while the bike was found on the bridge, the teenager was found dead with severe head injuries below, according to a report. An accidental death case has been filed in the matter.

326.title: Imams group asks Gurugram admin to stop namaz in undesignated places
326.article_body: A Gurugram-based association of Imams urged the district administration to stop some groups from offering namaz in undesignated public spaces of the city. The association submitted a memorandum to the administration citing that such acts could lead to communal disharmony and tension. Notably, several Hindu outfits have been protesting against Friday namaz in public spaces in Gurugram since 2018.

327.title: Hyd institute suspends students who beat youth over Prophet remark
327.article_body: A Hyderabad-based educational institute has suspended a group of students who were caught on camera assaulting a third-year law student after he allegedly insulted Prophet Muhammad. "The institution has acted with alacrity and has taken a decision to suspend all the concerned students with immediate effect. The institution has zero tolerance towards such undesirable acts," it said.

328.title: US President Biden calls Cambodia as Colombia at ASEAN summit, video goes viral
328.article_body: A video of US President Joe Biden calling Cambodia, which is hosting the ASEAN summit, as Colombia on Saturday has gone viral. "Now that we're back together here in Cambodia, I look forward to building even stronger progress than we've already made, and I want to thank the Prime Minister of Colombia for his leadership," Biden said.

329.title: If Sridevi got scripts like Meryl Streep's, she'd have won Oscars: Hussain
329.article_body: Actor Adil Hussain, during an interview, said the late actress Sridevi was "underutilised" in the film industry. He explained himself, "The kind of scripts she deserved...imagine her getting scripts which Meryl Streep gets...I somehow feel (with) her talent, hard work, dedication to make a character alive with truthfulness, she'd have won several Oscars," he added. Sridevi passed away in 2018.

330.title: Binance stops accepting deposits of FTX's FTT token
330.article_body: Cryptocurrency exchange Binance CEO Changpeng Zhao has said that the platform has stopped accepting deposits of FTX's FTT token, urging other rival exchanges to do the same. Binance has stopped FTT deposits "to prevent [the] potential of questionable additional supplies affecting the market". Earlier, Binance ended a deal to acquire FTX, which later filed for bankruptcy.

331.title: 11-yr-old boy waiting for auto dies after Jawhar bus depot wall collapses
331.article_body: An 11-year-old boy died while another teenager from the same family was injured after the Jawhar bus depot wall collapsed on them in Maharashtra. The family was visiting the area from Gujarat's Rajkot. Reports said that their parents had gone to the main road to get an autorickshaw and the boy and the other teenager were waiting on the spot.

332.title: Lalit Modi clarifies why he left India after receiving '20,000 questions' on LinkedIn
332.article_body: Ex-IPL Chairman Lalit Modi has clarified why he left India, saying that he has received over 20,000 questions regarding it on LinkedIn. Lalit said that he had no choice, citing media trial. He stated that journalists stirred things. He further stated that the government was not after him. He also citied 'fixing mafia' and jealously in BCCI as the reasons.

333.title: Selectors will take hard calls, but let's not talk about wholesale changes: Gavaskar
333.article_body: Former India captain Sunil Gavaskar has said there's no need for a "knee-jerk reaction" following India's exit from the 2022 T20 World Cup. "I know there are issues that can be looked at...but let's not talk about wholesale changes just because we lost," stated Gavaskar. "Had we gone to the final, we would've been talking about...the XI," he further said.

334.title: SS Rajamouli confirms 'RRR 2', says father is 'working on the story'
334.article_body: Director SS Rajamouli has confirmed that the sequel of 'RRR' is in development and his father and writer V Vijayendra Prasad is working on its story. "We discussed a bit about 'RRR 2' and he's working on the story," he said at an event. 'RRR', starring Jr NTR and Ram Charan, has reportedly collected over ₹1,100 crore worldwide.

335.title: J&K's Doda to be branded as role model in lavender farming: Union Minister
335.article_body: Union Minister Jitendra Singh has said that Jammu and Kashmir's Doda will be branded as a role model in India in lavender farming as farmers are taking it up on a commercial scale due to high profits. Singh said this while reviewing lavender cultivation in Doda. Nearly 400 farmers are involved in lavender cultivation in Doda, PTI reported citing officials.

336.title: Blinken meets Jaishankar, says, 'US supports India's G20 Presidency'
336.article_body: US Secretary of State Antony Blinken on Sunday met India's External Affairs Minister Dr S Jaishankar. After the meeting, Blinken tweeted, "The US supports India's G20 Presidency." Jaishankar called it a good meeting and added, "Discussed Ukraine, Indo-Pacific, energy, G20 and bilateral relations." India will preside over the G20 Summit from December 1.

337.title: Mukesh Ambani enters race to buy Liverpool Football Club: Reports
337.article_body: Reliance Industries Chairman Mukesh Ambani has reportedly entered the race to buy Liverpool Football Club. As per reports, the current owners of the club, Fenway Sports Group (FSG) are willing to sell the club for £4 billion. FSG had taken charge of Liverpool in 2010. FSG stated earlier this week they would be open to listening to offers for Liverpool.

338.title: 2016 Mumbai escalator to be removed, activist says '₹30 lakh will be wasted'
338.article_body: After Central Railway's decision to remove a 2016 escalator to make way for a new railway over bridge in Mumbai's Vidyavihar, RTI activist Anil Galgali has alleged that ₹30 lakh of public money will be wasted. He said the escalator's cost will go to waste due to CR's "bad planning" and that ₹2 lakh will be spent on its removal.

339.title: Video shows woman sticking head out of sunroof of car in Mumbai; police takes action
339.article_body: Mumbai Traffic Police has ordered action against a woman after a video showed her sticking her head out of a speeding car. A Twitter handle shared the video and wrote, "Sunroof is for letting the Sun in & Not the Head out." Responding to the video, police said, "We're sharing your concern with Bandra Traffic Division for necessary stringent action."

340.title: Elon gets a lot of hate, no one wants to be him: Musk's mother
340.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk's mother Maye Musk in a BBC documentary in the UK said her son is a genius and that because of his success he "gets a lot of hate". She admitted that despite many people admiring Musk's achievements, "no one wants to be him". Earlier, Maye said Bloomberg's headlines on Tesla are "always on the negative side".

341.title: Why are England players wearing black armbands in T20 WC 2022 final against Pakistan?
341.article_body: England players are wearing black armbands in the T20 World Cup 2022 final against Pakistan. This is in tribute to David English, who died aged 76 following a heart attack. David was founder of Bunbury Festival, an annual cricket tournament for Under-15 players. The festival has helped foster careers of 1,000 first-class cricketers in England, including 125 international cricketers.

342.title: Put up a good fight: Afridi wishes Pakistan for T20 World Cup final vs England
342.article_body: Ex-Pakistan cricketer Shahid Afridi took to Twitter to send his wishes to Babar Azam-led Pakistan for their T20 World Cup final against England. "This day has a special spot in our nation's heart...Wishing you all the best boys, put up a good fight. May you win," he tweeted. Pakistan entered the final after defeating New Zealand in the semi-final.

343.title: Man accuses sister-in-law of doing black magic, kills her in Pune
343.article_body: An FIR has been filed in Pune's Chandan Nagar Police Station after a 59-year-old man allegedly murdered his 54-year-old sister-in-law after accusing her of performing black magic on their family. The incident took place on Friday during a religious function at a person's house. The accused had also claimed that the deceased wasn't letting him meet his mother.

344.title: Slain boy's mother to contest by-election in Muzaffarnagar's Khatauli
344.article_body: The mother of the slain boy, Gaurav, has filed her nomination as an independent candidate for the by-election from Muzaffarnagar's Khatauli. The seat was declared vacant following the disqualification of BJP MLA Vikram Saini, who was convicted in the riots. Gaurav and his cousin were killed by a mob after the murder of Shahnawaz Qureshi over road rage.

345.title: AAP leader climbs tower after being denied ticket in MCD polls
345.article_body: AAP's former councillor Haseeb-ul-Hasan climbed a high-tension tower in Delhi's Shastri Park on Sunday after he was denied a ticket for the upcoming MCD polls. A video of the incident has surfaced. He claimed that AAP kept all the documents which he had submitted hoping to get a ticket. On Saturday, AAP released its final list of 117 candidates.

346.title: Hyd-origin man wins US' North Carolina senate race, elected 3rd time
346.article_body: Mujtaba Mohammed, whose family hails from Hyderabad, won the North Carolina senate race in the US. "I have officially been re-elected to my third term in the North Carolina senate," he tweeted after the results of mid-term elections were announced. Mohammed's parents lived in Hyderabad and migrated to the US in the 1980s. He will represent Mecklenburg County's 38th district.

347.title: Gurugram Police arrest 5 for abducting, sexually assaulting 30-year-old man
347.article_body: The Gurugram Police arrested five people for allegedly abducting and sexually assaulting a 30-year-old man after he failed to repay ₹2 lakh, borrowed from one of the accused. According to the police, the accused took the victim to Manesar, forced him to consume alcohol and then assaulted him. The accused also broke the victim's mobile phone and stole his car.

348.title: Hate & kill, then fete & reward: Mahua on BJP's poll ticket to Godhra MLA
348.article_body: While speaking about the Bharatiya Janata Party giving a poll ticket to Godhra MLA, Chandrasinh Kanaksinh Raulji, who had earlier called Bilkis Bano's rapists 'sanskari', TMC leader Mahua Moitra said that "this is the Gujarat Model". "Godhra MLA who called Bilkis case rapists & killers 'Sanskari Brahmins' is re-nominated by BJP...Hate & Kill. Then Fete & Reward," she tweeted.

349.title: England to field first in T20 World Cup 2022 final vs Pakistan, playing XIs out
349.article_body: England captain Jos Buttler won the toss and elected to field first in T20 World Cup 2022 final against Pakistan. Both England and Pakistan are fielding the same playing XIs that featured in the semi-finals. Pakistan are playing a T20 World Cup final after 13 years, while England are featuring in T20 World Cup final after six years.
