350.title: BJP busy distorting history, why can't Tipu's statue be built: Siddaramaiah
350.article_body: Former Karnataka CM Siddaramaiah gave his approval a day after Congress MLA Tanveer Sait promised to build a 100-foot-tall Tipu Sultan's statue and accused the BJP of distorting history. "Why can't Tipu's statue be built? Let them build, doesn't he deserve it? [The] BJP twists history. What did they say about...Ambedkar and others? They say false things," said Siddaramaiah.

351.title: Entire village on sale for ₹2 crore in Spain; pic surfaces
351.article_body: The entire Spanish village, Salto de Castro, is on sale for €260,000 (roughly ₹2 crore). The village reportedly has 44 homes, a hotel, a church, a school, a municipal swimming pool, a sports area and an old Civil Guard barracks. "I'm selling because I'm an urban-dweller and cannot maintain the upkeep," the man who bought the village in 2000s said.

352.title: No foul play in his death: Rajev on Siddhaanth Vir Surryavanshi
352.article_body: Actor Rajev Paul said that there "was no foul play" in the death of Siddhaanth Vir Surryavanshi, who passed away on Friday at the age of 46. Rajev added that he has "lost a brother" and shared that he was "genuinely very careful of his diet". "His daughter is my godchild. Maybe it was just his time," he mentioned.

353.title: Bring the trophy home, lads: Harry Kane, coach Southgate on Eng's T20 WC final
353.article_body: England men's football team manager Gareth Southgate and captain Harry Kane took to social media to send their best wishes to the England men's cricket team for their T20 World Cup final against Pakistan today. "We will be watching and hopefully, you can bring that trophy home. The whole country is behind you," said Kane.

354.title: Info Edge's net profit falls 97.99% to ₹168 cr in September quarter
354.article_body: Naukri-parent Info Edge recorded a fall of 97.99% year-on-year in its net profit to ₹168.10 crore in the September quarter. Its revenue increased by 51.22% to ₹531.82 crore in the quarter, up from ₹351.68 crore in the corresponding quarter last fiscal. Info Edge's total income stood at ₹581.75 crore, 47% up from ₹395.72 crore recorded a year ago.

355.title: Who has hit the most sixes in a T20 World Cup final?
355.article_body: Ex-West Indies all-rounder Marlon Samuels holds the record for smashing most sixes in a T20 World Cup final. He slammed six sixes against Sri Lanka in 2012 final against Sri Lanka. He's followed by Pakistan's Misbah-ul-Haq, India's Virat Kohli, West Indies' Carlos Brathwaite and Australia's Mitchell Marsh, who slammed four sixes each in 2007, 2014, 2016 and 2021 finals, respectively.

356.title: Who have won 'Player of the Match' award in finals in T20 World Cup history?
356.article_body: Ex-India all-rounder Irfan Pathan was named Player of the Match in T20 World Cup final in 2007. Ex-Pakistan captain Shahid Afridi won it in 2009. In 2010, England's Craig Kieswetter won the award, while Sri Lanka's Kumar Sangakkara won it in 2014. In 2012 and 2016, West Indies' Marlon Samuels won the award. Australia's Mitchell Marsh bagged it in 2021.

357.title: Hyderabad student beaten by a group of boys in hostel over Prophet remark, video surfaces
357.article_body: Police have registered a case against a group of students of the ICFAI Business School in Hyderabad after a video of a student being assaulted surfaced. The victim said he was beaten because of a personal chat with a girl, wherein he allegedly insulted Prophet Muhammad. He said he was kicked in his testicles and was threatened to be killed.

358.title: Driver fails to escape vehicle as landslide hits in Kerala, washed away
358.article_body: A 45-year-old man who was allegedly driving a tempo traveller failed to escape from the vehicle as a landslide hit the Munnar-Vattavada road in Kerala's Idukki. He was washed away in the landslide, police said. "All other vehicles and passengers managed to escape but he is suspected to have been trapped inside the vehicle," police added.

359.title: Drones detected along India-Pak border doubled in 2022: BSF DG
359.article_body: The number of drone flights detected along the India-Pakistan international border has more than doubled this year, according to the BSF Director General (DG) Pankaj Kumar Singh. He said that of the total 266 drone flights detected, 215 drone flights were seen in Punjab this year. Singh was speaking at the inauguration of the BSF Drone Forensic Laboratory.

360.title: 5 BJP leaders threaten to contest as independents in Guj polls
360.article_body: At least five BJP leaders have threatened to contest as independents in the upcoming Gujarat Assembly elections after being denied tickets. They are Harshad Vasava, Madhu Shrivastav, Dinesh Patel, Satish Patel and Arvind Ladani. Vasava filed his nomination from Nandod as an independent on Friday. Meanwhile, state minister Harsh Sanghavi said, "BJP is like a family and all members...are united."

361.title: 'Twilight' actor Taylor Lautner marries girlfriend Taylor Dome; pics surface
361.article_body: 'The Twilight Saga' actor Taylor Lautner and his longtime girlfriend Taylor Dome got married at Epoch Estate Wines in US' California on Friday. Around 100 of their closest friends and family members attended their wedding. The couple reportedly began dating after meeting in 2018 and got engaged in November last year.

362.title: We knew we were better than them: Shadab on India-Pak T20 WC match
362.article_body: Pakistan all-rounder Shadab Khan, during an interview ahead of their 2022 T20 World Cup game against England, recalled their match against India during the group stage and said that though they lost that game, they knew they were the better side. "We knew if we give our 100 per cent, the result will come on our side," he added.

363.title: Feel good: Biden as Dems retain control of Senate in mid-term polls
363.article_body: After the Democrats retained control of the US Senate in mid-term elections, President Joe Biden said, "I know I'm coming in stronger...I feel good and I'm looking forward to the next couple of years." Democrats will now have 50 seats in the 100-member Senate with the Republicans currently on 49. Senator Catherine Cortez Masto won from Nevada.

364.title: What have been the highest and lowest totals scored in finals in T20 World Cup history?
364.article_body: Australia's 173/2 in T20 World Cup 2021 final against New Zealand is the highest total in a T20 World Cup final. It's followed by New Zealand's 172/4 in last year's final, which Australia successfully chased. Sri Lanka's 101 against West Indies in 2012 final is lowest total, while India's 130/4 against Sri Lanka in 2014 final is the second-lowest total.

365.title: Glenn Maxwell slips and falls during a birthday party, breaks his leg
365.article_body: Australia all-rounder Glenn Maxwell broke his leg during a birthday party in Melbourne. The 34-year-old cricketer and the person celebrating his 50th birthday were running in a backyard when both slipped and fell, with Maxwell's leg becoming trapped under the other person's. Maxwell underwent surgery on Sunday and has been ruled out of cricket for an extended period.

366.title: Not SRK but his bodyguard was stopped at airport over luxury watches: Mumbai Customs
366.article_body: Mumbai Customs clarified that officials stopped Shah Rukh Khan's bodyguard Ravi Singh at airport for violating customs rules and not the actor. "The bodyguard had two luxurious watches and four empty watch boxes. Apart from this, there was also an empty box of an iWatch Series 8 in his luggage," Mumbai Customs said. They had to pay ₹6.83-lakh custom duty.

367.title: I'm a legend because I've surpassed struggles in life: Mithun
367.article_body: Actor Mithun Chakraborty said that he's not legendary because of hit films, but he's a legend because he "surpassed all the pains and struggles" in his life. "I've fought a lot to prove myself in this (film) industry," he added. The actor mentioned that he doesn't want a biopic on himself because it'll "never inspire anyone" to achieve their dreams.

368.title: Took 11 yrs, but the wait was worth it: Bosco on directorial debut
368.article_body: Choreographer-turned-director Bosco Martis said that it took 11 years for him to make his directorial debut. Bosco, who directed the recently released film 'Rocket Gang', said the wait was "worth it". "I was tested but with every year, I grew and learnt something," he said, adding that dance will 'always be' an integral part of his storytelling.

369.title: Woman injured after leopard attacks her in Mumbai's Aarey colony
369.article_body: A 34-year-old woman was injured after a leopard attacked her in Mumbai's Aarey colony, police said on Saturday. The leopard had pounced on the woman, who was returning from her workplace, after she ran on seeing the animal and fell down, a police official said. This is the second such incident to take place in the area this month.

370.title: I voted for Tharoor but won't join BJP ever: Cong leader's reply to Assam CM
370.article_body: Following Assam CM's claim that 1,000 Congress leaders who supported Shashi Tharoor in INC polls will likely join the BJP soon, Congress leader Salman Soz stated that he will never join the BJP, even if it becomes the only party left. "I was one of the 1,072 delegates who voted for Tharoor...We lost, but internal party democracy won," Salman tweeted.

371.title: Campuses must become incubators for startups: Goyal to institutes
371.article_body: Union Minister Piyush Goyal in an interaction with the heads and senior faculty members of IIFT and NID, among others, said that every campus must become an incubator for startups and "must strive to nurture and develop innovation and entrepreneurship". He asked the institutions to introspect if their education is tailormade to cater to the needs of tomorrow.

372.title: Life hasn't given you tight slaps: Shweta to Navya in talk over women's issues
372.article_body: Shweta Bachchan said it is very easy for her daughter Navya Naveli Nanda, as a 24-year-old, to say one should "block out noise" while industries work on attacking women's self-esteem. "You are young...life hasn't given you...a few tight slaps," she told Navya. "There is too much economics behind women not feeling like they look like a million bucks," Shweta said.

373.title: 'Drunk' driver rams car on footpath in Pune; 2 people injured
373.article_body: At least two people were injured after a car driver rammed the vehicle on a footpath and dragged one of them for a few metres in Pune. "We've detained the car driver and found that he was under the influence of alcohol," a senior police inspector said. According to a complaint, the car driver lost control of the vehicle.

374.title: Shall hesitate to go to his funeral: Amitabh on director Rakesh Kumar
374.article_body: Actor Amitabh Bachchan said that he "shall hesitate to go to" filmmaker Rakesh Kumar's funeral, who passed away on November 10. "I shall not be able to bear the sight of an inert Rakesh," he said, adding that he left "an imprint that is hard to remove or forget". He called Rakesh "a most affable and kind hearted human".

375.title: TRS MP donates ₹1 cr to govt hospital in Hyd where he was born
375.article_body: TRS Rajya Sabha MP Santosh Kumar J on Friday donated ₹1 crore to a government hospital in Hyderabad where he was born. Telangana Health and Finance Minister Harish Rao Thanneeru said the funds will be used for the development of the maternity hospital in Petlaburj. "It is commendable that Santosh remembered the hospital where he was born," Rao added.

376.title: Bengaluru South School Leaders' Council holds first meet at BJP MP's office
376.article_body: The Bengaluru South School Leaders' Council held its first meeting on Saturday at the office of BJP MP Tejasvi Surya. Over 40 student leaders from around 25 schools attended the meeting and discussed the future action plan. The Council will also host a sports event for government school students in December. The Council is responsible for conducting quarterly events.

377.title: Australia to consider banning paying of ransoms to cyber criminals
377.article_body: Australia will consider making the paying of ransoms to cyber hackers illegal, Home Affairs Minister Clare O'Neil said. This comes after Australia's biggest health insurer, Medibank, was hit by a massive cyber attack last month. Singapore Telecommunications-owned telecom company Optus, along with at least eight other companies, have been breached since September.

378.title: UK influencer who had 18 surgeries to look like Korean woman says 'want to be man again’
378.article_body: A year after British-born influencer Oli London revealed he underwent 18 cosmetic surgeries to look like a Korean woman, he announced, "I'm no longer trans and have gone back to living as a man." London said that identifying as 'transracial' was a "big mistake", adding, "I just want to be a boy." He wanted to resemble BTS singer Park Jimin.

379.title: FTX ex-CEO denies flying to S America, says he's in Bahamas
379.article_body: Former CEO of bankrupt crypto exchange FTX Sam Bankman-Fried has denied rumors that he has flown to South America. He told Reuters he was in the Bahamas. Earlier, Flightradar24 tweeted that the former crypto billionaire was flying from Nassau to Argentina. Bankman-Fried stepped down as CEO of FTX the day it filed for Chapter 11 bankruptcy protection in the US.

380.title: Remote employee not disclosing location costs US startup $30,000
380.article_body: US-based GravyWork CEO Alex Atwood told the WSJ that he received notices for not registering his business in Texas and California and was asked to pay $30,000 in taxes and fees. This happened after a former software engineer worked from those states for long periods without informing him. He said the estimated price GravyWork paid for the issue was $500,000.

381.title: People of north India should see us as victims, not killers: Rajiv Gandhi case convict
381.article_body: RP Ravichandran, one of the six convicts who was released on Saturday in the assassination case of former Prime Minister Rajiv Gandhi, said that the people of north India should see them as "victims instead of terrorists or killers". "Time and power determine who is a terrorist or a freedom fighter but time will judge us as innocent," he added.

382.title: Hundreds of activists protest at COP27 in Egypt, enter UN territory
382.article_body: Hundreds of environmental activists staged a demonstration at the ongoing UN climate summit in Egypt, known as COP27, and called on industrialised nations to pay for the impact of global warming. The protesters marched through the conference's 'Blue Zone' which is considered United Nations' territory. Subsequently, German officials raised concerns about surveillance and intimidation of delegates.

383.title: Family of brain dead 18-month-old girl donates her organs in Delhi
383.article_body: The family of an 18-month-old girl, Mahira, who was declared brain dead at Delhi's AIIMS, has donated her organs. A native of Haryana, Mahira fell from her house's balcony. Her liver was transplanted in a six-month-old child at the Institute of Liver and Biliary Sciences, while both her kidneys were transplanted successfully in a 17-year-old boy at AIIMS.

384.title: I am very sorry for them: Rajiv Gandhi assassination convict Nalini Sriharan to Gandhis
384.article_body: After her release from prison on Saturday, Nalini Sriharan, a convict in former PM Rajiv Gandhi's assassination case, said she felt "very sorry" when asked about her message for the Gandhis and families of those who were killed. "They have lost their dear ones. I hope they will come out of that tragedy once for all, any time," Nalini said.

385.title: Cong claims EVMs carried in private vehicles in Himachal's Rampur, urges ECI to take action
385.article_body: Congress has claimed that Electronic Voting Machines were carried in private vehicles in Rampur during the Himachal Pradesh Assembly elections. Calling it an "utterly unfortunate incident", Congress legal cell working chairman Pranay Pratap Singh asked the Chief Electoral Officer to "take cognisance in the said matter".  "The BJP party shall make a mockery out of elections," his complaint read.

386.title: Smuggler arrested in Noida with over 174 kg marijuana worth ₹50 lakh
386.article_body: The Gautam Buddha Nagar Police and UP Special Task Force arrested a man, Ajju, for allegedly smuggling over 174 kg of marijuana worth ₹50 lakh. "The suspect was carrying marijuana in his personal car, along with three other accomplices from Rajahmundry in Andhra Pradesh…The vehicle used by the suspect for smuggling the drug has also been seized," said Noida's ADCP.

387.title: Actor-filmmaker Rakesh Kumar passes away aged 81 after battling cancer
387.article_body: Veteran actor and filmmaker Rakesh Kumar passed away on November 10 in Mumbai after a long battle with cancer. He was known for his work in films like Khoon Pasina, Do Aur Do Paanch, Mr Natwarlal and Yaarana among other films. Amitabh Bachchan condoled his demise and wrote, "Another colleague has left us and me in particular."

388.title: Jaishankar meets his Ukrainian counterpart, discusses nuclear concerns
388.article_body: India's External Affairs Minister Dr S Jaishankar met his Ukrainian counterpart Dmytro Kuleba in Cambodia on the sidelines of the ASEAN-India summit on Saturday. "Our discussions covered recent developments in the conflict, the grain initiative and nuclear concerns," Jaishankar tweeted. "I met to discuss bilateral cooperation and ways to end Russia's war on Ukraine," Kuleba said about the meeting.

389.title: Bajrang Dal activist killed in crude bomb attack in Jharkhand
389.article_body: A Bajrang Dal activist was killed after crude bombs were hurled at him by men on motorcycles in Jharkhand's West Singhbhum on Saturday, police said. The activist was taken to hospital where doctors declared that he was brought dead. Hundreds of the deceased's supporters gathered following the incident and the CRPF was called to maintain law and order, police added.

390.title: NHRC holds Delhi, Haryana, Punjab & UP governments responsible for stubble burning
390.article_body: The National Human Rights Commission (NHRC) on Saturday held the Delhi, Haryana, Punjab and Uttar Pradesh governments responsible for the continued stubble burning. The commission said that it is of the opinion that farmers are burning stubble "under compulsion". It also asked the state and Union Territory governments to submit affidavits on points raised by it within four days.

391.title: 'Stree 2' might be the next film, says director Amar Kaushik
391.article_body: Director Amar Kaushik said that the sequel of 'Stree' "might be" his next directorial film. "I'm aware that people will compare the sequel to the first part...yes, we have got an idea and 'Stree 2' might be the next film," he stated. Kaushik, who is currently promoting 'Bhediya', called Varun Dhawan the "most curious", "most enthusiastic" and "most passionate" actor.

392.title: ICC shares rankings of Pakistan, England players ahead of T20 World Cup 2022 final
392.article_body: Ahead of Pakistan-England T20 World Cup 2022 final, the ICC shared rankings of Pakistan and England players. England have more batters in top 100, while Pakistan's Muhammad Rizwan and Babar Azam are ranked second and fourth, respectively. Both Pakistan and England have three bowlers each in top 25, while Moeen Ali is top-ranked T20I all-rounder among the two teams.

393.title: Who will win 2022 T20 World Cup final? I'm going with Pakistan: Aakash
393.article_body: Cricketer-turned-commentator Aakash Chopra has predicted Pakistan to win the 2022 T20 World Cup final against England on Sunday. "Who will win? I feel Pakistan will win...I don't think it will be a very high-scoring match," he said in a video posted on his YouTube channel. England reached the final after defeating India in the semi-final on Thursday.

394.title: What is the head-to-head record of Pakistan and England in T20I cricket?
394.article_body: England and Pakistan have played 28 matches against each other in T20Is. Pakistan have won nine times, while England have won 18 times including once in Super Over. One of their matches produced no result. Pakistan's highest total against England in 232/6 registered in 2021, while England's highest total against Pakistan is 221/3 recorded in September this year.

395.title: Man protests in Bengaluru after accident due to pothole, video surfaces
395.article_body: A video went viral on social media of a man seen protesting by sitting on the road in Bengaluru after falling from his scooter due to a pothole. He can be heard asking for a response from the BBMP officials. "Thanks to CV Raman Nagar MLA...for keeping Bengalurians [struggling] with their lives every day," read a Twitter post.

396.title: Flood alert for 5 Tamil Nadu districts, 4,230 cubic feet excess water discharged from dam
396.article_body: A flood alert has been issued for Theni, Dindigul, Madurai, Sivaganga and Ramanathapuram districts, news agency ANI reported. The dam officer said that 4,230 cubic feet of excess water has been discharged from Vaigai Dam in Theni. In October 2022, a flood alert was issued for 11 districts in the state.

397.title: Ganderbal DM bans use of electric heating appliances, later amends order
397.article_body: Amid the winter chill in J&K, the Ganderbal DM on Friday released an order banning the use of electric heating appliances. The order stated that the decision was taken to avoid unscheduled power cuts and provide a hassle-free electricity supply to consumers. After outrage, the order was amended to ban nichrome coil-based crude water heaters and crude cooking heaters.

398.title: We've got nothing to lose but everything to win: Akhtar on Pak-Eng T20 WC final
398.article_body: Ex-Pakistan fast bowler Shoaib Akhtar, in a video posted on his social media, said they've got nothing to lose but everything to win in the 2022 T20 World Cup final against England. "Pakistan were nowhere and now [in the final]...our team is looking like a solid unit...we [only] need to play our A game," he added.

399.title: Anupam Kher fails to get Uunchai ticket as shows run housefull, shares video
399.article_body: Actor Anupam Kher shared a video of himself trying to buy a ticket for his movie 'Uunchai'. In the video, the man at the ticket counter can be seen telling him that there is no ticket available as the shows of the film are running housefull. "For the first time, saw success in failure," he wrote.

400.title: Former AIIMS Delhi director Randeep Guleria takes voluntary retirement
400.article_body: Randeep Guleria, former director of All India Institute of Medical Sciences in Delhi, has taken voluntary retirement. Reports said Guleria served the institute for over 30 years. His five-and-a-half-year tenure as the director of the institute ended on September 23. He applied for Voluntary Retirement Scheme. Guleria had joined AIIMS as an assistant professor in Department of Medicine in 1992.

401.title: Donald Trump's daughter Tiffany marries businessman Michael Boulos; pics surface
401.article_body: Former US President Donald Trump and his ex-wife Marla Maple's daughter Tiffany Trump and Michael Boulos got married in Mar-a-Lago on Saturday. Trump escorted his 29-year-old daughter down the aisle before she exchanged vows with the 25-year-old businessman. Melania, Ivanka, Eric, Donald Trump Jr were also present at the wedding.

402.title: Don't want people to gamble: Amit on refusing sports app endorsement
402.article_body: Actor Amit Sadh recently refused to endorse a sports app as he didn't want to promote something "that falls into grey areas". He said that even though he has huge respect for the game, he doesn't want people to gamble. "I don't wish to promote such things knowing how bad it can get. I would personally feel responsible," he shared.

403.title: 2-yr-old girl falls into open water tank at building, dies in Pune
403.article_body: A two-year-old girl died after she fell into an open water tank at an under-construction building in Pune. Following this, police booked the builder and contractor over their alleged negligence. The girl's father, who works as a labourer at the under-construction building, claimed in a complaint that the accused hadn't taken proper measures like covering the tank with a lid.
